English: Individually formidable and collectively nightmarish, these four sinister sisters share two burning obsessions: mastering necromancy and reclaiming eternal youth. Unfortunately, achieving these noble goals requires extensive experimentation on unwilling participants - essentially, everyone is still breathing.\nEach sister wields distinct dark powers, but their endless sibling rivalry often undermines their evil plans. Family squabbles about who looks the youngest or who worked more regularly to interrupt battles. But their mutual hatred for the living unites them more firmly than mere blood ever could, and while eternal youth continues to evade them, eternal bitterness is something they've mastered long ago.
English (reviewed): Individually formidable and collectively nightmarish, these four sinister sisters share two burning obsessions: mastering necromancy and acquiring eternal youth. Unfortunately, achieving these noble goals requires extensive experimentation on unwilling participantsâincluding anyone still breathing.\nEach sister wields distinct dark powers, but their never-ending sibling rivalry often undermines their evil plans. Their squabbles usually concern who looks the youngest or who has worked harder to interrupt battles. But their mutual hatred for the living unites them more firmly than mere blood ever could, and while eternal youth continues to evade them, eternal bitterness is something they mastered long ago.
German: Diese vier unheimlichen Schwestern sind schon einzeln furchterregend, aber gemeinsam ein einziger Albtraum. Sie haben zwei brennende Obsessionen: die Beherrschung der Nekromantie und die Erlangung ewiger Jugend. Leider erfordern diese edlen Ziele umfangreiche Experimente an unfreiwilligen Versuchspersonen - jeder, der noch atmet, ist ein mÃ¶glicher Kandidat.\nZwar verfÃ¼gt jede der Schwestern Ã¼ber eigene finstere KrÃ¤fte, doch ihre endlose GeschwisterrivalitÃ¤t durchkreuzt regelmÃ¤Ãig ihre bÃ¶sen PlÃ¤ne. Bei ihren Streitereien geht es fÃ¼r gewÃ¶hnlich darum, wer jÃ¼nger aussieht oder wer sich mehr MÃ¼he gegeben hat, KÃ¤mpfe zu unterbrechen. Doch ihr gemeinsamer Hass auf die Lebenden verbindet sie stÃ¤rker, als es bloÃes Blut vermag. Und wÃ¤hrend ihnen die ewige Jugend weiterhin verwehrt bleibt, sind sie in Sachen ewige Bitterkeit schon lÃ¤ngst Meisterinnen.
Spanish: Formidabili singolarmente e terrificanti collettivamente, queste quattro sinistre sorelle condividono due ossessioni ardenti: padroneggiare la negromanzia e ottenere la giovinezza eterna. Sfortunatamente, raggiungere questi nobili obiettivi richiede ampi esperimenti su partecipanti non consenzienti â inclusi tutti coloro che ancora respirano.\nOgni sorella brandisce poteri oscuri distinti, ma la loro eterna rivalita' fraterna spesso compromette i loro piani malvagi. I loro litigi riguardano di solito chi sembra piu' giovane o chi ha fatto di piu' per interrompere le battaglie. Tuttavia, il loro odio condiviso per i vivi le unisce piu' di quanto farebbe il solo legame di sangue, e sebbene la giovinezza eterna continui a sfuggire loro, lâamarezza eterna e' qualcosa che hanno gia' padroneggiato da tempo.

English: In a realm of egotistical overlords and would-be tyrants, Malathrax stands apart - mostly because he refuses to share power or credit. Obsessed with absolute control, he views kings and queens as mere nuisances. To him, your dabbling in magic isn't just irritating - it's offensively presumptuous.\nMalathrax meticulously plans world domination down to every detail. His armies march flawlessly, his demons file timely reports, and his chambers are famously spotless. Don't mistake his meticulousness for vanity; his burning gaze and hellfire spell real power. Unfortunately, your name currently tops his "Urgent Eliminations" list.

German: In einem Reich egoistischer Despoten und MÃ¶chtegern-Tyrannen sticht Malathrax besonders hervor - vor allem, weil er weder Macht noch Anerkennung mit jemandem teilen will. Er ist besessen von absoluter Kontrolle und hÃ¤lt KÃ¶nige und KÃ¶niginnen fÃ¼r nichts weiter als lÃ¤stige Randfiguren. Spanish: In un regno popolato da signori egocentrici e aspiranti tiranni, Malathrax si distingue â soprattutto perche' si rifiuta di condividere potere o meriti. Ossessionato dal controllo assoluto, considera re e regine semplici seccature. Per lui, i tuoi esperimenti con la magia non sono solo irritanti: sono un'offesa presuntuosa.\nMalathrax pianifica la conquista del mondo nei minimi dettagli. Sfortunatamente, il tuo nome e' attualmente in cima alla sua lista di ''Eliminazioni Urgenti''.

English: Among dragons, Volkar is notoriously ill-tempered, known for blistering rage and an unhealthy gold obsession. His vast hoard seems less about wealth and more a coping mechanism for unresolved anger - though no one dares suggest this close to his lair.\nVolkar enjoys personal confrontations, chewing through foes with unsettling enthusiasm. When pressed, he takes to the skies, engulfing enemies - and unlucky bystanders - in molten flames. Some say Volkar's greed is his greatest weakness, others wisely observe that it is, in fact, being repeatedly stabbed by heroes. Sadly, very few live long enough to test this theory.
English (reviewed): Among dragons, Volkar is notoriously ill-tempered, known for his blistering rage and unhealthy obsession with gold. His vast hoard seems less about wealth and more a coping mechanism for unresolved angerâthough no one dares voice this within earshot of his lair.\nVolkar enjoys personal confrontations, chewing through foes with unsettling enthusiasm. When pressed, he takes to the skies, engulfing enemiesâand unlucky bystandersâin molten flames. Some say Volkar's greed is his greatest weakness; others wisely observe that it is, in fact, the sharp weapons of heroes. Sadly, very few live long enough to test this latter theory.

Spanish: Tra i draghi, Volkar e' tristemente noto per il suo carattere irascibile, la sua furia rovente e unâossessione malsana per lâoro. Il suo immenso tesoro sembra avere meno a che fare con la ricchezza e piu' con un meccanismo di compensazione per una rabbia irrisolta â anche se nessuno osa dirlo a voce alta nei pressi della sua tana.\nVolkar ama lo scontro diretto, divorando i nemici con un entusiasmo inquietante. Se messo alle strette, prende il volo e avvolge nemici â e sfortunati spettatori â in fiamme fuse. Alcuni dicono che la sua avidita' sia la sua debolezza piu' grande; altri, piu' saggiamente, osservano che lo siano le armi affilate degli eroi. Purtroppo, ben pochi vivono abbastanza a lungo da verificare questâultima teoria.

English: Goblins are perpetual opportunists - looting, plundering, and ruining someone's day even during an apocalypse. And then, there's Gorzog. Towering grotesquely above his kin, he's roughly siege-tower-sized and equally subtle. No one's sure what he's been eating (or whom), but it clearly wasn't balanced.\nGorzog leads through brute force, casual cruelty, and a strict 'biggest-club-wins' philosophy. His warfare strategy: swing first, ask questions never, and leave complex planning to smaller minds - which, admittedly, includes nearly everyone.
English (reviewed): Goblins are perpetual opportunistsâthey engage in looting, plundering, and ruining people's day, even during an apocalypse. And then, there's Gorzog. Towering grotesquely above his kin, he's roughly siege-tower-sized and equally subtle. No one's sure what (or whom) he's been eating, but it's clearly not involved a balanced diet.\nGorzog leads through brute force, casual cruelty, and a strict 'biggest-club-wins' philosophy. His warfare strategy is to swing first, ask questions never, and leave complex planning to smaller mindsâwhich, admittedly, includes nearly everyone.

German: Kobolde sind notorische Opportunisten - sie plÃ¼ndern, brandschatzen und ruinieren den Leuten den Tag, sogar wÃ¤hrend einer Apokalypse. Und dann ist da noch Gorzog. Er ragt grotesk Ã¼ber seine Artgenossen hinaus - etwa so groÃ wie ein Belagerungsturm und genauso unauffÃ¤llig. Niemand weiÃ genau, was (oder wen) er frisst - doch ausgewogen ist seine ErnÃ¤hrung ganz offenbar nicht.\nGorzog herrscht mit roher Gewalt, beilÃ¤ufiger Grausamkeit und der festen Ãberzeugung, dass der mit dem grÃ¶Ãten KnÃ¼ppel das Sagen hat. Seine Kriegsstrategie besteht darin, zuerst zuzuschlagen, niemals Fragen zu stellen und komplexe Planungen kleineren KÃ¶pfen zu Ã¼berlassen - was zugegebenermaÃen fast jeden mit einschlieÃt.
Spanish: I goblin sono opportunisti per natura: saccheggiano, depredano e rovinano la giornata alla gente anche durante un'apocalisse. E poi c'e' Gorzog. Alto in modo grottesco rispetto ai suoi simili, ha le dimensioni di una torre d'assedio ed e' altrettanto discreto. Nessuno sa con certezza cosa (o chi) abbia mangiato, ma di sicuro non si tratta di una dieta equilibrata.\nGorzog guida con la forza bruta, la crudelta' disinvolta e una ferrea filosofia del âvince chi ha la clava piu' grossaâ. La sua strategia di guerra consiste nel colpire per primo, non fare domande mai, e lasciare la pianificazione complessa alle menti piu' piccole â il che, a onor del vero, include quasi tutti.

English: Precisely how this monstrosity came to exist is fiercely debated by terrified scholars and tavern drunkards alike. Some say it's a goblin warlord who made a reckless pact with eldritch powers. Others insist it's a demon imprisoned by ancient dragons and force-fed goblins - admittedly something dragons might enjoy.\nWhatever its origin, its hunger is legendary and alarmingly literal. From the abyssal void within its grotesque maw, fresh goblins spew forth fully formed, eager to rampage and ruin. It's unclear if this is an intentional strategy or simply indigestion, but either way, it's extremely inconvenient for everyone involved. Approach the Maw with caution and preferably with someone slower than you close behind.
English (reviewed): Precisely how this monstrosity came to exist is fiercely debated by terrified scholars and tavern drunkards alike. Some say it's a goblin warlord who made a reckless pact with eldritch powers. Others insist it's a demon that was imprisoned by ancient dragons and force-fed goblinsâadmittedly, something dragons might enjoy.\nWhatever its origin, its hunger is legendary and alarmingly literal. From the abyssal void within its grotesque maw, fresh goblins spew forth fully formed, eager to rampage and ruin. It's unclear if this is an intentional strategy or simply indigestion, but either way, it's extremely inconvenient for everyone involved. Approach the Maw with caution and preferably with someone slower than you close behind.

German: Wie es zu dieser MonstrositÃ¤t kam, darÃ¼ber streiten sich verÃ¤ngstigte Gelehrte und Trunkenbolde gleichermaÃen heftig. Manche sagen, es sei ein Kobold-Kriegsherr, der einen rÃ¼cksichtslosen Pakt mit unheimlichen MÃ¤chten geschlossen habe. Andere behaupten, es handle sich um einen DÃ¤mon, der einst von uralten Drachen gefangen und mit Kobolden gefÃ¼ttert wurde - zugegeben, ganz nach dem Geschmack der Drachen.\nWas auch immer sein Ursprung ist, sein Hunger ist legendÃ¤r - und erschreckend wÃ¶rtlich zu nehmen. Aus dem abgrÃ¼ndigen Schlund seines grotesken Mauls quellen stets frische Kobolde hervor - bereit, in blinder ZerstÃ¶rungswut Ã¼ber alles herzufallen. Ob es sich dabei um eine gezielte Strategie handelt oder einfach nur um eine VerdauungsstÃ¶rung, ist unklar - in jedem Fall ist es fÃ¼r alle Beteiligten ziemlich unangenehm. NÃ¤hert Euch dem Schlund mit Ã¤uÃerster Vorsicht - und idealerweise mit jemandem im Schlepptau, der langsamer ist als Ihr.
Spanish: Lâesatta origine di questa mostruosita' e' oggetto di accesi dibattiti tra studiosi terrorizzati e ubriaconi da taverna. Alcuni dicono sia un signore della guerra goblin che ha stretto un patto sconsiderato con poteri arcani. Altri sostengono sia un demone imprigionato da antichi draghi e nutrito a forza con goblin â cosa che, in effetti, potrebbe anche divertire i draghi.\nQualunque sia la verita', la sua fame e' leggendaria e allarmantemente letterale. Dal vuoto abissale della sua grottesca bocca emergono goblin freschi, completamente formati e ansiosi di devastare e distruggere. Non e' chiaro se si tratti di una strategia intenzionale o solo di cattiva digestione, ma in entrambi i casi e' estremamente sconveniente per chiunque si trovi nei paraggi. Avvicinati alla Fauce con cautela â e, se possibile, con qualcuno piu' lento di te alle spalle.

English: If you thought Gorzog was trouble, meet his better - and far more terrifying - half, Margra. Every bit the warlord her husband is, Margra has twice the brains and half the patience. Rumors say Gorzog's impressive size is largely due to stress-eating from her fiery temper - though no goblin dares say it aloud.\nMargra plans battles with ruthless efficiency, usually while berating her husband for overlooking crucial details. Her iron flail swings relentlessly, matching her brutally sharp tongue. Legend says she once frightened off a battalion by loudly criticizing their armor. Don't underestimate her - after all, she's survived marriage to Gorzog.

Spanish: Se pensavi che Gorzog fosse un problema, conosci la sua meta' migliore â e di gran lunga piu' terrificante â Margra. E' una signora della guerra a tutti gli effetti, con il doppio del cervello e la meta' della pazienza del marito. Si dice che lâimponente stazza di Gorzog sia dovuta in gran parte allo stress da fame causato dal carattere infuocato di Margra â anche se nessun goblin osa dirlo ad alta voce.\nMargra pianifica le battaglie con efficienza spietata, di solito mentre rimprovera il marito per aver trascurato dettagli cruciali. La sua mazza ferrata colpisce senza sosta, allâaltezza della sua lingua tagliente. La leggenda narra che una volta abbia messo in fuga un intero battaglione criticandone ad alta voce le armature. Non sottovalutarla â dopotutto, e' sopravvissuta a un matrimonio con Gorzog.

English: Born of countless corpses and excessive dark magic, the Graveyard Golem is a walking (occasionally sleeping) testament to poor cemetery management. Known locally as the Wandering Graveyard, it emerges sporadically, shuffling aimlessly until finding a comfortable napping spot.\nTechnically harmless while dormant - if you ignore the giant undead creature napping nearby - it becomes violently destructive if disturbed. Awakened prematurely, it rampages uncontrollably, obliterating everything until peace returns. Your best bet might be quietly tiptoeing around it - but subtlety rarely suits kings.
English (reviewed): Born of countless corpses and excessive dark magic, the Graveyard Golem is a walking (occasionally sleeping) testament to poor cemetery management. Known locally as the Wandering Graveyard, it emerges sporadically, shuffling aimlessly until it finds a comfortable napping spot.\nThough technically harmless while dormantâif you're able to ignore the giant undead creature napping nearbyâit becomes violently destructive if disturbed. If awakened prematurely, it rampages uncontrollably, obliterating everything until peace returns. Your best bet might be quietly tiptoeing around itâbut subtlety rarely suits kings.
German: Aus zahllosen Leichen und mÃ¤chtiger schwarzer Magie geboren, ist der Friedhofsgolem ein wandelndes (und gelegentlich schlafendes) Mahnmal fÃ¼r schlechte Friedhofspflege. Lokal als Wandernder Friedhof bekannt, taucht er dann und wann auf und schlurft ziellos umher, bis er einen gemÃ¼tlichen Schlafplatz findet.\nWÃ¤hrend er schlÃ¤ft, ist er technisch gesehen harmlos - sofern man es schafft, das riesige untote Wesen in der NÃ¤he zu ignorieren. Wird er jedoch gestÃ¶rt, kennt er kein Erbarmen. Wenn er vorzeitig geweckt wird, wÃ¼tet er unkontrolliert und zerstÃ¶rt alles, bis wieder Ruhe einkehrt. Am besten schleicht Ihr auf Zehenspitzen um ihn herum - allerdings sind KÃ¶nige selten fÃ¼r ihr FeingefÃ¼hl bekannt.
Spanish: Nato da innumerevoli cadaveri e da un eccesso di magia oscura, il Golem del Cimitero e' una testimonianza ambulante (a volte dormiente) della pessima gestione dei cimiteri. Conosciuto localmente come il Cimitero Errante, emerge sporadicamente, trascinandosi senza meta finche' non trova un posto comodo dove schiacciare un pisolino.\nTecnicamente e' innocuo mentre dorme â se riesci a ignorare lâenorme creatura non morta che sonnecchia li' vicino â ma diventa violentemente distruttivo se viene disturbato. Se svegliato prima del tempo, si scatena in una furia incontrollabile, annientando tutto finche' non torna la calma. La strategia migliore potrebbe essere aggirarlo in punta di piedi â ma la discrezione raramente si addice a un re.

English: Sir Mortifax is a rare breed among undead horrors - a meticulous scientist equally skilled in forbidden magic and swordplay. He harbors no particular hatred for your kingdom, viewing living beings merely as bundles of interesting raw materials for his ambitious, unethical experiments.\nHis laboratory overflows with disturbing notes, charts, and suspiciously labeled jars. Heroes challenging Mortifax discover he's more curious than cruel, often pausing mid-battle to record observations like "remarkable resistance to dismemberment." Unfortunately, participation in his research usually results in death - or at best, prolonged undead discomfort.
English (reviewed): Sir Mortifax is a rare breed among undead horrors: a meticulous scientist equally skilled in forbidden magic and swordplay. He harbors no particular hatred for your kingdom, viewing living beings merely as bundles of interesting raw materials for his ambitious, unethical experiments.\nHis laboratory overflows with disturbing notes, charts, and suspiciously labeled jars. Heroes who challenge Mortifax discover that he's more curious than cruel, often pausing mid-battle to record observations, such as a "remarkable resistance to dismemberment." Unfortunately, participation in his research usually results in deathâor, at best, prolonged undead discomfort.

German: Sir Mortifax ist eine seltene Erscheinung unter den untoten Schrecken: ein akribischer Wissenschaftler, gleichermaÃen bewandert in verbotener Magie und Schwertkunst. Er hegt keinen besonderen Hass gegen Euer KÃ¶nigreich, sondern sieht Lebewesen vielmehr als Ansammlungen interessanter Rohstoffe fÃ¼r seine ehrgeizigen, unethischen Experimente.\nSein Labor ist vollgestopft mit verstÃ¶renden Notizen, Diagrammen und verdÃ¤chtig beschrifteten GlÃ¤sern. Helden, die Mortifax herausfordern, stellen fest, dass er eher neugierig als grausam ist und im Kampf oft innehÃ¤lt, um Beobachtungen festzuhalten - wie etwa eine "bemerkenswerte Resistenz gegen VerstÃ¼mmelung". Leider endet die Teilnahme an seinen Experimenten meist tÃ¶dlich - oder bestenfalls in langanhaltendem untoten Leiden.
Spanish: Sir Mortifax e' un caso raro tra gli orrori non morti: uno scienziato meticoloso, esperto tanto nella magia proibita quanto nel combattimento con la spada. Non prova un odio particolare per il tuo regno; considera gli esseri viventi semplicemente come insiemi di materiali grezzi interessanti per i suoi ambiziosi e discutibili esperimenti.\nIl suo laboratorio e' pieno zeppo di appunti inquietanti, grafici e barattoli etichettati in modo sospetto. Gli eroi che sfidano Mortifax scoprono che e' piu' curioso che crudele, e spesso si ferma a meta' battaglia per annotare osservazioni, come una ânotevole resistenza allo smembramentoâ. Sfortunatamente, partecipare alle sue ricerche porta di solito alla morte â o, nel migliore dei casi, a un prolungato disagio da non morto.

English: Mordain takes overseeing the undead realm extremely seriously - perhaps too seriously. Among wraiths, he's regarded as an overbearing bureaucrat, complete with endless paperwork and meticulous midnight soul counts. Any disturbance immediately tops his spectral to-do list.\nIronically, Mordain could help against aggressive necromancers - except your enthusiasm for excavating tombs blatantly violates his policy against "disturbing deceased persons." It's nothing personal, just regulation. Now, his patience exhausted, Mordain has prepared his scythe to enforce a permanent restraining order on your meddling.
English (reviewed): Mordain takes overseeing the undead realm extremely seriouslyâperhaps too seriously. Among wraiths, he's regarded as an overbearing bureaucrat, complete with endless paperwork and meticulous midnight soul counts. Any disturbance immediately tops his spectral to-do list.\nUnder different circumstances, Mordain could prove quite helpful against aggressive necromancersâexcept that your enthusiasm for excavating tombs blatantly violates his policy against "disturbing deceased persons." It's nothing personal, just regulation. Now, with his patience exhausted, Mordain has prepared his scythe to enforce a permanent restraining order on your meddling.

German: Mordain nimmt die Aufsicht Ã¼ber das Reich der Untoten sehr ernst - vielleicht sogar zu ernst. Unter den Geistern gilt er als Ã¼berheblicher BÃ¼rokrat - mit endlosen Aktenbergen und akribischen SeelenzÃ¤hlungen um Mitternacht. Jede StÃ¶rung steht sofort ganz oben auf seiner gespenstischen To-do-Liste.\nUnter anderen UmstÃ¤nden kÃ¶nnte Mordain gegen aggressive Nekromanten nÃ¼tzlich sein - doch Eure Begeisterung fÃ¼rs GrÃ¤berausheben verstÃ¶Ãt eindeutig gegen seine Regel, "die Verstorbenen nicht zu stÃ¶ren". Es ist nichts PersÃ¶nliches, nur eine Vorschrift. Nun, da seine Geduld erschÃ¶pft ist, hat Mordain seine Sense bereit, um eine dauerhafte VerfÃ¼gung gegen Euer Eingreifen durchzusetzen.
Spanish: Mordain prende il suo ruolo di supervisore del regno dei non morti estremamente sul serio â forse fin troppo. Tra gli spettri, e' considerato un burocrate soffocante, con una montagna di scartoffie e meticolosi conteggi delle anime a mezzanotte. Qualsiasi disturbo finisce immediatamente in cima alla sua lista spettrale delle cose da fare.\nIn altre circostanze, Mordain potrebbe rivelarsi utile contro i necromanti aggressivi â se non fosse che il tuo entusiasmo per gli scavi nelle tombe viola palesemente la sua politica contro il âdisturbo delle persone defunteâ. Niente di personale, solo regolamento. Ora, con la pazienza esaurita, Mordain ha affilato la falce per imporre un ordine restrittivo permanente alle tue interferenze.

English: In a cruel cosmic joke, Araknor began as a terrifyingly large spider - until a careless necromancer became his unfortunate snack. Along with that meal Araknor gained attunement to dark magic and spent centuries mastering his sinister new powers.\nNo longer relying on webs, Araknor now openly prowls the world, his transformed body a lethal engine of undead horror. His multiple limbs wield deadly force, while his spells drain life from enemies. For Araknor, hunting isn't catching prey - it's selecting precisely what he desires and claiming it. Unfortunately, your kingdom is his next prey.
English (reviewed): In what must be a cruel cosmic joke, Araknor began as a terrifyingly large spiderâuntil a careless necromancer became his unfortunate snack. Along with that meal, Araknor gained an attunement to dark magic and spent centuries mastering his sinister new powers.\nNo longer relying on webs, Araknor now openly prowls the world, his transformed body a lethal engine of undead horror. His multiple limbs wield deadly force, while his spells drain life from enemies. For Araknor, hunting isn't just about catching preyâit's a process of selecting precisely what he desires and claiming it. Unfortunately, your kingdom is his next target.
German: In einem grausamen kosmischen Scherz begann Araknor als riesige, furchterregende Spinne - bis ein unachtsamer Nekromant zu seinem unglÃ¼cklichen Snack wurde. Mit dieser Mahlzeit erhielt Araknor eine Verbindung zur dunklen Magie und verbrachte Jahrhunderte damit, seine finsteren neuen KrÃ¤fte beherrschen zu lernen.\nEr verlÃ¤sst sich lÃ¤ngst nicht mehr auf Netze, sondern streift nun frei durch die Welt - sein verwandelter KÃ¶rper eine tÃ¶dliche Maschine des untoten Schreckens. Seine zahlreichen GliedmaÃen entfalten tÃ¶dliche Kraft, wÃ¤hrend seine Zauber den Feinden das Leben aussaugen. FÃ¼r Araknor geht es bei der Jagd nicht nur um die Beute, sondern um das gezielte AuswÃ¤hlen und Erlegen seines Opfers. UnglÃ¼cklicherweise ist Euer KÃ¶nigreich sein nÃ¤chstes Ziel.
Spanish: In quella che devâessere una crudele ironia cosmica, Araknor nacque come un ragno spaventosamente grande â finche' un necromante distratto non fini' nel suo stomaco. Con quel pasto, Araknor acquisi' una sintonia con la magia oscura e passo' secoli a perfezionare i suoi nuovi e sinistri poteri.\nNon fa piu' affidamento sulle ragnatele: ora Araknor si aggira liberamente per il mondo, con un corpo trasformato in una letale macchina di orrore non morto. I suoi molteplici arti colpiscono con forza mortale, mentre i suoi incantesimi prosciugano la vita dai nemici. Per Araknor, cacciare non significa solo catturare una preda â e' un processo di selezione precisa di cio' che desidera, per poi reclamarlo. Sfortunatamente, il suo prossimo obiettivo e' il tuo regno.

English: Venoxia's triple-headed form makes it a legendary menace - but complicates internal communication. Each head has a strict rule: one speaks only truth, another tells only lies, and the third impatiently devours anyone who starts a boring conversation.\nHeroes facing Venoxia quickly learn their best weapons aren't swords or spells, but clever debate tactics. Sadly, no topic has yet distracted all three heads at once - though discussions on dungeon etiquette came close. So your army will fare better with swords and magic.

Sadly, no topic has yet distracted all three heads at onceâthough discussions on dungeon etiquette came close. So your army might fare better using swords and magic.

Jeder Kopf folgt einer strengen Regel: Einer spricht nur die Wahrheit, ein anderer erzÃ¤hlt nur LÃ¼gen, und der dritte verschlingt ungeduldig jeden, der eine langweilige Unterhaltung beginnt.\nHelden, die Venoxia gegenÃ¼berstehen, lernen schnell, dass ihre besten Waffen nicht Schwerter oder Zauber sind, sondern clevere DebattierkÃ¼nste. English: Once a noble devoted to protecting his lands, Lord Draven now finds himself trapped between ambition and appetite. His quest for strength led him down the dark path of vampirism - unfortunately without instructions or dietary warnings.\nNow Draven seeks dominion over beings who share his curse, tired of mortal subjects inconveniently dying from old age or "accidental" blood-loss. Yet his insatiable hunger drives him toward conquering annoyingly vibrant kingdoms of the living - like yours. Don't be fooled by his noble manners; they're merely a faÃ§ade for monstrous appetites.

His quest for strength led him down the dark path of vampirismâunfortunately without instructions or dietary warnings.\nNow, Draven seeks dominion over beings who share his curse, having tired of mortal subjects inconveniently dying from old age or "accidental" blood loss. Yet his insatiable hunger drives him to conquer annoyingly vibrant kingdoms of the livingâlike yours. Don't be fooled by his noble manners; they're merely a faÃ§ade for his monstrous appetite.

German: Einst ein edler BeschÃ¼tzer seiner LÃ¤ndereien, ist Lord Draven nun gefangen zwischen Ehrgeiz und Gier. Sein Streben nach Macht hat ihn auf den dunklen Pfad des Vampirismus gefÃ¼hrt - leider ohne Anleitung oder ErnÃ¤hrungshinweise.\nNun strebt Draven die Herrschaft Ã¼ber jene an, die seinen Fluch teilen - denn von Sterblichen, die an AltersschwÃ¤che oder "unfallbedingtem" Blutverlust sterben, hat er langsam genug. Doch sein unstillbarer Hunger treibt ihn an, unangenehm lebendige KÃ¶nigreiche wie Eures zu erobern. Lasst Euch nicht von seinen vornehmen Manieren tÃ¤uschen; sie sind nur eine Fassade fÃ¼r seinen monstrÃ¶sen Appetit.
Spanish: Un tempo nobile devoto alla protezione delle sue terre, Lord Draven si ritrova ora intrappolato tra ambizione e appetito. La sua ricerca di potere lo ha condotto lungo il sentiero oscuro del vampirismo â purtroppo senza istruzioni o avvertenze dietetiche.\nOra Draven cerca di dominare creature che condividono la sua maledizione, essendosi stancato di sudditi mortali che muoiono scomodamente di vecchiaia o per âperdita di sangue accidentaleâ. Eppure la sua fame insaziabile lo spinge a conquistare fastidiosi regni ancora pieni di vita â come il tuo. Non lasciarti ingannare dai suoi modi nobili: sono solo una facciata per il suo appetito mostruoso.

English:
Here you can see all the troops that you have recruited. 
You can order your units to go into the barracks where they won't be able to participate in fights. This is useful when you wish to hire new stronger troops but don't have space in your army.

The troops in the barracks can be let out later and can serve you as your backup army.
English (reviewed):
Here, you can see all the troops that you have recruited. 
You can order your units to go into the barracks where they won't be able to participate in fights. This is useful when you wish to hire new, stronger troops but don't have space in your army.

The troops in the barracks can be let out later and can serve as your backup army.

Qui puoi vedere tutte le truppe che hai reclutato.

Le truppe nella caserma possono essere fatte uscire in seguito e servire come esercito di riserva.

English:
Sire, you have reached the Graveyard, this place is notoriously bad at staying quiet.
I must inform you about local currency: {&1} Relics. The best way to find them is to dig through local Ruins, although some may object to being disturbed.

A certain lady merchant has set up shop near the cemetery - she deals in rare goods and, most curiously, the occasional reanimated soldiers. You can spend your Relics there.

I advise you to recruit a couple of Ruins scouts to start exploring the Ruins.

As a result, the kingdom applauds your forward-thinking leadership, and your prosperous rule continues unquestioned.

English (reviewed): You enthusiastically authorize the mass production of the Potion of Bull's Energy, and productivity immediately skyrockets - at least initially. Unfortunately, your kingdom soon faces an epidemic of overly energetic peasants tilling fields at midnight, causing numerous accidents and a few spectacular explosions. On the bright side, this bizarre situation attracts curious scholars who eagerly drink the potion to finish "just one more chapter" of their beloved tomes.

German: Ihr genehmigt begeistert die Massenproduktion des Bullen-Energietranks und die ProduktivitÃ¤t geht durch die Decke - zumindest anfangs. Leider wird Euer KÃ¶nigreich bald von einer Epidemie Ã¼bermÃ¼tiger Bauern heimgesucht, die um Mitternacht ihre Felder bestellen und zahlreiche UnfÃ¤lle und sogar ein paar spektakulÃ¤re Explosionen verursachen. English (reviewed): You wisely implement strict regulations and establish controlled distribution areas, restricting potion usage to essential tasks only. The peasants loudly grumble about bureaucracy, yet controlled doses ensure both greater stability and fewer hallucinations. Unsurprisingly, a thriving black market emerges, complete with shadowy midnight exchanges and whispered passwords. You turn a blind eye - especially since grateful black market leaders regularly send you generous gifts of luxurious wines, greatly boosting the stock in your royal cellar.

German: In weiser Voraussicht fÃ¼hrt Ihr strenge Vorschriften ein, richtet kontrollierte Verteilungszentren ein und beschrÃ¤nkt den Konsum des Tranks auf die wichtigsten Aufgaben. English (reviewed): While your commander wisely deems the potion too risky for battlefield deployment, it proves remarkably effective during rigorous training drills. The accelerated exercises help you rapidly expand your retinue, attracting new recruits eager to test their limits. Sadly, the potion's intensity soon leads to the chief trainer experiencing a heart attack... and another... and another. After the third incident, you reluctantly cancel the initiative. Even so, your retinue remains impressively large - if a bit shaken.

Purtroppo, lâintensita' della pozione porta il capo istruttore a subire un infartoâ¦ e un altroâ¦ e un altro ancora. Dopo il terzo episodio, annulli con riluttanza lâiniziativa. English (reviewed): Initially, the tome demands blood, but after accidentally spilling your finest wine upon its pages, it discovers a preference for vintage reds over crimson bodily fluids. Several bottles later, the thoroughly intoxicated tome cheerfully reveals arcane secrets that can enhance the range of your royal gaze. Your expanded oversight astonishes your workers, who now have fewer places to hide from your vigilant eyes.
German: Zu anfangs verlangt der WÃ¤lzer nach Blut, aber nachdem Ihr versehentlich Euren besten Wein auf ihm verschÃ¼ttet, entdeckt er seine Vorliebe fÃ¼r edlen Rotwein statt roter KÃ¶rperflÃ¼ssigkeiten. Ein paar Flaschen spÃ¤ter ist er vÃ¶llig betrunken und enthÃ¼llt frÃ¶hlich arkane Geheimnisse, die die Reichweite Eures kÃ¶niglichen Blicks deutlich erweitern. Euer erweiterter Ãberblick verwundert Eure Arbeiter, die nun noch weniger Orte haben, an denen sie sich vor Euren wachsamen Augen verstecken kÃ¶nnen.
Spanish: Inizialmente, il tomo richiede sangue, ma dopo che il tuo vino migliore viene versato accidentalmente sulle sue pagine, sviluppa una preferenza per i rossi dâannata rispetto ai fluidi corporei cremisi. Dopo diverse bottiglie, il tomo ormai completamente ubriaco rivela allegramente segreti arcani in grado di ampliare il raggio del tuo sguardo reale. On the bright side, your fearless irreverence inspires your subjects, greatly boosting kingdom morale - though your fields might suffer from a bit more leisure on the part of the peasants.

English (reviewed): You swiftly launch a strict productivity campaign under the ominous slogan "Work, or Else!" Surprisingly, this hands-on approach proves wonderfully calming, freeing your royal mind from its usual burdens. Inspired, you invent several clever improvements to your kingdom's buildings - though your advisors are nervous about you enforcing them to follow your meditation practice.

Unfortunately, this mainly results in the terrified peasants working furiously just to get you to stop "helping." On the bright side, amidst your magical mishaps, you gain inspiration for a promising new spell.

They also conveniently forget all their past complaints about wages.

English (reviewed): You command your servants to swiftly evacuate the nobles, generously offering to carry their valuable luggage to lighten their load. Conveniently, much of that luggage - especially the gold and fine wines - finds its way directly into your own treasury and cellar. Your nobles are relieved (if slightly confused), and you enjoy a tidy profit. A good day for everyone!

English (reviewed): You declare solemnly that no mortal can oppose the divine will, choosing instead to calmly watch the events unfold. Even your priests seem baffled by your inaction, politely questioning your theology under their breath. Kingdom morale understandably dips, but cleverly taxing the subsequent reconstruction efforts yields a bounty of high-quality lumber. Perhaps the divine will really does provide - for you.

Determined volunteers soon present you with a captured mushroom warrior, which confirms the story and frightens away the Forest King and his fungal army in the process. Surprisingly, visitors hanging around the ponds feel compelled to justify their loitering by offering unsolicited, yet brilliant, suggestions for engineering upgrades - some of which are implemented to impressive effect. Who knew mermaids could inspire such innovation?

English: In a showcase of your cleverness, you craft a convincing golem replica of the unfortunate soldier from water and dramatically behead it. English: Realizing that any benefit your subjects receive counts as income, you promptly introduce a "Forest Bounty Tax." All materials, whether wood, gold, or oddly glowing mushrooms, are covered by your new policy. The merchants grumble, but your treasury swells with the new revenue. Even the forest spirits seem impressed by your economic cunning.

Even the forest spirits seem impressed by your economic cunning.

English: Determined to assert your absolute authority, you lure the trusting spirits to a carefully prepared ritual site and transform them into powerful mana crystals. Your mage is thrilled, your magical resources skyrocket, and the merchants wisely pretend not to notice the sudden absence of their spectral guides. After all, only you get to bestow (or revoke) fortune in your kingdom.
English (reviewed): Determined to assert your absolute authority, you lure the trusting spirits to a carefully prepared ritual site and transform them into powerful mana crystals. Your mage is thrilled, your magical resources skyrocket, and the merchants wisely pretend not to notice the sudden absence of their spectral guides. After all, only you get to bestow (or revoke) fortune in your kingdom.

English: You graciously accept Farto's offer, granting the goblins their respite - on the strict condition they surrender their weapons. Who knew an encounter with goblins could improve your army's gear?

English: Rejecting diplomacy outright, you decisively crush the remaining goblin forces. Their defeat is swift, brutal, and thoroughly satisfying for your soldiers. Victory celebrations last for days, though your janitors complain endlessly about the abundance of goblin helmets left behind on the battlefield. Sadly, some of their relatives come to avenge their dead kin.
English (reviewed): Rejecting diplomacy outright, you decisively crush the remaining goblin forces. Their defeat is swift, brutal, and thoroughly satisfying for your soldiers. Sadly, some of their relatives come to avenge their dead kin.

English: In a dazzling display of your magical prowess, you skillfully convince the goblins you are, in fact, a deity. Awestruck, they swear allegiance on the spot. Though their combat abilities aren't particularly impressive, their loyalty soon proves unexpectedly useful - they eagerly help rescue captured hunters from other goblin bands, adding some much-needed archers to your army.
English (reviewed): In a dazzling display of your magical prowess, you skillfully convince the goblins you are, in fact, a deity. Awestruck, they swear allegiance on the spot. Though their combat abilities aren't particularly impressive, their loyalty soon proves unexpectedly useful - they eagerly help rescue captured hunters from other goblin bands, adding some much-needed archers to your army.

A GIANT success, indeed.

English: Embracing the motto "no pain, no gain," you embark on an intense fitness regime. After vigorous royal exercise sessions (accompanied by slightly terrified trainers), you reclaim your former physique and inspire a kingdom-wide fitness craze. Deciding to share your newfound passion, you commission the construction of an arena dedicated to sports, competitions, and entertainingly sweaty contests of royal athleticism.

English: Adopting a principle of "no mirrors, no problems," you order every reflective surface to be destroyed immediately. Your subjects are baffled, yet relieved by fewer reminders of reality. Meanwhile, the reclaimed glass is masterfully transformed into wine bottles for your now abundantly stocked cellar. After all, the best way to silence your concerns is to wash them down with more feasts - and more wine.

English: You firmly remind your nobles that their options are to share their grain or face your royal displeasure - or something sharper. Reluctantly, they restock the granaries, ensuring your subjects are fed. The nobles mutter and sigh dramatically but are wise enough to hold their tongues, aware that a slightly lighter banquet is infinitely preferable to a significantly lighter head.

English: You ingeniously command that the castle moats be drained to provide drinking water. Although the moat water is somewhat questionable (and mildly green), your peasants survive. Freed from field labor by necessity, many turn their talents to crafting fine furniture, enriching your court's interiors considerably. Your advisors quietly thank the drought for finally replacing those wobbly thrones.

English: Deciding this isn't a problem worthy of your royal attention, you simply draw the curtains to block out the distressing sight. With generous orders of wine, you throw lavish parties behind closed doors until the drought passes. While your kingdom endures hardship, your court enjoys uninterrupted revelry. After all: out of sight, out of mind - certainly when drowned in good wine.

After all: out of sight, out of mind - certainly when drowned in good wine.

English: You watch the blaze with unsettling glee, composing poetry and playing your lyre amidst the chaos, inspired by the glorious spectacle of flames. English: With no siege equipment, the marauders prove hilariously ineffective. Their attempts to climb your walls or slash them with swords fail spectacularly, accompanied by creative but equally ineffective curses. Meanwhile, taxing the peasants sheltering behind your robust defenses conveniently yields enough gold to further enhance the fortifications - turning an invasion attempt into a fundraising opportunity.

English: You summon the terrifying power of your magical gaze, forming a giant, intimidating eye in the sky. Amused by their terror, you further refine this visual trick, improving your kingdom's magical intimidation - and entertainment - capabilities.

English: You cunningly invite Tharg and his commanders to a feast for negotiations, as well as generously offering them a soothing soak in your kingdom's "luxurious hot mud springs." Unbeknownst to them, the mud quickly hardens, hilariously trapping them mid-bath. Desperately bargaining for freedom, Tharg reveals detailed attack plans, surrenders his favorite artifact, and almost sacrifices his dignity - though you mercifully interrupt before things get too awkward.

English: You decisively order the destruction of the gaudy crown, instantly improving your treasury's aesthetic. As the crown shatters, you feel a curious sense of relief - though your mage mournfully mutters about lost magical potential. On the bright side, your reputation for having an impeccable fashion sense (and avoiding cursed accessories) spreads rapidly through the neighboring lands.

English: Rather than wearing the suspicious crown yourself, you cunningly donate it to the royal madhouse. Oddly enough, the residents there seem perfectly comfortable with its supposed side effects. Soon, the madhouse thrives with creative energy - and slightly more gibbering. Your advisors cautiously commend your decision, noting that madness and genius often dance together in entertaining ways.

English: Ingeniously, you repurpose the mysterious orb as a luxurious heating source for your royal bathhouse. English: The music echoes joyfully through your kingdom. One entrepreneurial nobleman points out that the skeletons look too similar and designs fancy outfits to tell them apart. Calling the process "labelling," he quickly trademarks their music and imposes a special "undead entertainment" tax on locals. You graciously allow his venture - following the delivery of a generous, purely voluntary royal gift.

You graciously allow his venture - following the delivery of a generous, purely voluntary royal gift.

English: You cleverly distract the strange guest with abundant wine and charming servant girls, continuously refilling his glass until he's suitably intoxicated and ready to divulge all his secrets. Your mage then engages him in lengthy, puzzling discussions about self-moving chariots, descriptions of legendary demigods from a ship called "Star Trek," and perplexing explanations of how he arrived in your kingdom. At dawn, your bewildered mage escorts the guest out. Despite considerable confusion, your mage manages to extract valuable insights from the traveler's tale, providing you some additional magical knowledge.

The knights bravely storm the crypt but soon discover that Bravemir was completely right - pillaging isn't so simple after all. Your troops return victorious yet visibly shaken, haunted by memories of endless undead poetry recitals amidst deadly combat. Thankfully, they manage to grab a few treasures during the chaos, and now your men truly appreciate the finer things in life - like silence.

Thankfully, they manage to grab a few treasures during the chaos, and now your men truly appreciate the finer things in life - like silence.
